byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Negotiations over Iran's nuclear program continue late into night as deadline nears; many difficult issues, including Iran's intention to keep its nuclear stockpile in country, may remain unresolved when talks end.
lead_paragraph: An Iranian official had seemed to rule out an accord under which the fuel would be sent abroad, but American negotiators said the issue had not yet been decided.

headline.main: ‘Tricky Issues’ Remain as Deadline Nears in Nuclear Talks With Iran
headline.print_headline: ‘Tricky Issues’ Remain as Deadline Nears in Nuclear Talks With Iran

snippet: An Iranian official had seemed to rule out an accord under which the fuel would be sent abroad, but American negotiators said the issue had not yet been decided.
